alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 2:21PM CST until December 29 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Mississippi. In West Tennessee, Haywood, Lauderdale, Shelby and Tipton. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Reports of minor flooding in Millington with water ponding on roadways. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Millington, Covington, Ripley, Wilson, Fort Pillow State Park, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Memphis, Munford, Brighton, Halls, Ft Pillow, Fulton, Dixonville, Nutbush, Forked Deer, Tipton, Atoka, Henning, Gates and Gilt Edge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
